site_name: NAVAJO NATION ZOO AND BOTAN PK

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During inspection, an expired drug was being used for sedated exam procedures for some of the animals on site,
including the two bobcats. The use of expired drugs is not an appropriate method for preventive diagnostic care of wild
animals and may result in prolonged recovery time or other adverse events. The licensee shall maintain a program of
adequate veterinary care to include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 5/13/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During inspection, an expired drug was being used for sedated exam procedures for some of the animals on site, 
including the two bobcats.  The use of expired drugs is not an appropriate method for preventive diagnostic care of wild 
animals and may result in prolonged recovery time or other adverse events.  The licensee shall maintain a program of 
adequate veterinary care to include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 5/13/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
End Section
